question_text:
The graph shows triangles RST and R'S'T'.
Which sequence of transformations maps RST onto R'S'T'?
backend_description: The image shows two triangles, RST and R'S'T', on a coordinate grid. Triangle RST is drawn in pink with vertices at R(-5,-3), S(-9,-5), and T(-8,-2). Triangle R'S'T' is drawn in green with corresponding vertices at R'(2,7), S'(6,5), and T'(5,8). The triangles are congruent and have the same shape and size. Based on the positions of the points, triangle R'S'T' appears to be the result of a translation followed by a reflection. Specifically, triangle RST is translated 3 units right and 10 units up, then reflected across the y-axis to map onto triangle R'S'T'.
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
choices: a reflection across the x-axis followed by a rotation 90° clockwise around the origin
a translation right 3 units and up 10 units followed by a reflection across the y-axis
a rotation 180° around the origin followed by a translation left 3 units and up 4 units
solution: This sequence of transformations maps RST onto R'S'T'.

✅ a translation right 3 units and up 10 units followed by a reflection across the y-axis
First,translate RST right 3 units and up 10 units to map it onto R''S''T''.Then,reflect R''S''T'' across the y-axis to map it onto R'S'T'.
These sequences do not map RST onto R'S'T'.

❌ a reflection across the x-axis followed by a rotation 90° clockwise around the origin
First,reflect RST across the x-axis to map it onto R''S''T''. Then,rotate R''S''T' 90° clockwise around the origin. This does not map R''S''T'' onto R'S'T'.

❌ a rotation 180° around the origin followed by a translation left 3 units and up 4units
First,rotate RST 180° around the origin to map it onto R''S''T''. Then, translate R''S''T'' left 3 units and up 4 units. This does not map R''S''T''onto R'S'T'.
solution_image_tag: The image shows triangle RST (pink) with vertices at R(–5, –3), S(–9, –5), and T(–8, –2), and its translated image R″S″T″ (blue) with vertices at R″(–2, 7), S″(–6, 5), and T″(–5, 8). The triangle was translated 3 units to the right and 10 units up. The shape, size, and orientation remain unchanged.

The image shows triangle RST (pink) with vertices R(–5, –3), S(–9, –5), and T(–8, –2), and its transformed image R″S″T″ (blue) after reflecting across the x-axis and rotating 90° clockwise around the origin. The resulting triangle has vertices R″(–5, 3), S″(–9, 5), and T″(–8, 2). This triangle is congruent to RST but does not align with triangle R′S′T′ (green), which has vertices R′(2, 7), S′(6, 5), and T′(5, 8), so this transformation is incorrect.

The image shows triangle RST (pink) with vertices R(–5, –3), S(–9, –5), and T(–8, –2), and its transformed image R″S″T″ (blue) with vertices R″(5, 3), S″(9, 5), and T″(8, 2). This triangle was formed by rotating RST 180° around the origin, then translating it 3 units left and 4 units up. While the triangle is still congruent to RST, it does not align with triangle R′S′T′ (green), which has vertices R′(2, 7), S′(6, 5), and T′(5, 8), so this sequence is incorrect.

question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
choices: a reflection across the x-axis followed by a rotation 90° clockwise around the origin
a rotation 180° around the origin followed by a translation left 2 units and up 9 units
a translation right 2 units and up 9 units followed by a reflection across the y-axis
solution: This sequence of transformations maps ABC onto A'B'C'.

❌ a reflection across the x-axis followed by a rotation 90° clockwise around the origin
